title: Frame Skip with V-SYNC Enabled
body:
The question is WHY?  
 
I have frame skip with fps uncapped or with vsync enable...

i will play with 60 fps (then vsync enabled) but i can't... if i set cap 60 fps without vsync the game run like a crap with slowest movement and its not smooth

atm i play with 144fps capped and its fine but i prefer run the game with  vsync cause its more smooth in the late game phase.

The support tell me can be a problem with some GPU.

SPEC:
i5 4670
MSI GTX 770 2GB
8GB 

i can run heavy games, and vsync work well in all games but League Of Legends.

replies.body: What's the model number of your Monitor? Also, check your in-game settings under the **GAME** category and ensure that **movement prediction** isn't enabled. With that information, I can point you in the right direction of resolving this.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=byWAPtgi,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-07-27T21:21:03.823+0000)
>
> What's the model number of your Monitor? Also, check your in-game settings under the **GAME** category and ensure that **movement prediction** isn't enabled. With that information, I can point you in the right direction of resolving this.

i have an ASUS VE248H 24" 60hz 
movement prediction is disabled... i check a solution for this problem about months :P

I explain better... my game runs completely fine at 144fps capped but in very late game the fps aren't  stable (30+ minutes) they drop like 90 fps in some situations or with some champions and the game seems run a bit more slower/choppy.. if i play with vsync that not happen cause the game runs always at 60 fps and its very more smooth in all situations

i have a lot of friends playing with vsync enable, and they haven't the stutter problem, and this is more noticeble in the early phase of the game.

PS: One member of the italian support anwser me, its a knowed issue with some GPU, and they will work for solve this in the future but its hard cause there are too many hardware solutions, i have to trust him? :D

Maybe he told me this just for get to rid of me XD

I will bet with the nvidia control panel i can solve the issue, BUT League Of Legends now is no more responsive with the nvidia control panel. If i enable Vsync from it ... don't change nothing. 

ps: sorry if my english suck :P

I'm not aware of any known issues with Nvidia GPU's and FPS instabilities. Generally speaking, playing without VSYNC is prone to causing instability in FPS and screen tearing. Because VSYNC forces your GPU to sync every frame with your display, it's unlikely to cause erratic spikes in FPS during normal gameplay. As you mentioned, your monitor's refresh rate is 60Hz, therefore running anything over 60FPS will provide negligible results in performance.

You may be running a poorly-optimized driver version for League, and perhaps rolling back to [Nvidia driver version 362.00](http://www.nvidia.com/download/driverResults.aspx/99202/en-us) will provide a better experience. This is the latest super-stable driver I've seen for League. 

Let me know if you have any additional questions.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=byWAPtgi,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-07-28T15:53:55.543+0000)
>
> I'm not aware of any known issues with Nvidia GPU's and FPS instabilities. Generally speaking, playing without VSYNC is prone to causing instability in FPS and screen tearing. Because VSYNC forces your GPU to sync every frame with your display, it's unlikely to cause erratic spikes in FPS during normal gameplay. As you mentioned, your monitor's refresh rate is 60Hz, therefore running anything over 60FPS will provide negligible results in performance.
> 
> You may be running a poorly-optimized driver version for League, and perhaps rolling back to [Nvidia driver version 362.00](http://www.nvidia.com/download/driverResults.aspx/99202/en-us) will provide a better experience. This is the latest super-stable driver I've seen for League. 
> 
> Let me know if you have any additional questions.

i tried the driver you suggested me... the problem still happens (i'm not completely sure but seems the fps are more stable in late game if i play without vsync... then i will stay a bit more with these drivers for some testing ^^)

i can show u a video with my same issue i've found it online... (i ve already show it at the support, if someone has watched this but u already know their useless answer -.-) 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qmokp5Jb-RI&feature=youtu.be&t=44

He set VSYNC on at 0.44s and he have some frame skip from 0.50s until 1 min
 
He show the game too without vsync capped at 60 fps and some animations are not completely smooth but the frame skip problem being solved. (he explain all my same issues in the video pls watch it and tell me ur opinion about this issue :D)

I noticed today while frame skip happened my fps raise to 63  with vsync enabled that can mean something? 
I never saw that in other games, with vsync i stay always at 59/60 fps never goes over 60.

i can try rollback divers but i think will not solve nothing :D atm i have the very latest driver 368.81

You obviously dont understand how V-sync works. Frame skipping or stuttering in a normal part of vsync, thats why people generally dont use it.  If a frame takes longer to render using vsync then your screen refresh rate then the frame is held in a buffer until the next refresh cycle which can cause perceived stutter because the frame is being delayed.

 Thats just how it works, this is the reason for these like Gsync and Freesync, because generally speaking vsync sucks and has high input lag.

> [{quoted}](name=Gidor,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=byWAPtgi,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-07-27T21:59:11.246+0000)

If a frame takes longer to render using vsync then your screen refresh rate then the frame is held in a buffer until the next refresh cycle which can cause perceived stutter because the frame is being delayed.
> 
>  Thats just how it works, this is the reason for these like Gsync and Freesync, because generally speaking vsync sucks and has high input lag.

dude i know how vsync works, i use it in a lot of games , i don't use only in fps game like cs. i haven't imput lag  in league of legends, and i know a lot of people playing league of legends with it enabled. Gsync is good for variable frame rate and not have tearing in all situations, but i can't buy a GSYNC monitor for playng leauge of legends... seriously :P

stop link me this dude :D

this article talk about frame skip without vsync or without a cap at fps... i know how solve this... but my problem its related to vsync and i haven't movement prediction yet

Oh, now I see your full case. 

You mentioned now you're using Vsync, I recommend disabling it with LoL for the time being.

You also stated that you're in contact with Support via a ticket? If yes, continue chatting with them.

its the name of the thread "

Frame Skip with V-SYNC Enabled" XD

i'm not still in contact with them... was like 2 months ago... and they can't solve nothing then i try to search a solution in the forum :D

I play without vsync atm... with 144 fps cap... and its ok but i want know WHY i can't enable it... too many people play with vsync without my issue.
